state.description: This is where you might entertain friends...if you had any. The room is dimly lit by a lamp and the weak, jittering light of the fireplace. You see a comfy, albeit slightly moldy, arm chair facing the fireplace; your phone atop a spindly table; and a bookcase full of books you’ve skimmed. There is the front door, a window, the door to the kitchen, and a staircase leading to the second floor.

item.name: Arm Chair
item.description: Almost bursting at the seams from years of your curvy physique pressing upon it.

item.name: Phone
item.description: Your beige connection to civilization is looking awfully inadequate right now. You know there is a mostly empty address book in a drawer in the table the phone sits upon.

item.name: Address Book
item.description: A small book titled “My Friends! (and Their Numerical Telephone Numbers)” A few numbers have been scrawled on the first page.

item.name: Fireplace
item.description: A warm fire roars cozily in the old brick fireplace.

item.name: Front Door
item.description: Its dark wood looms ominously now you know someone unexpected lurks behind it. There is a peep hole that you never thought you’d need to use.

item.name: Staircase
item.description: A plain white banister and stairs lead up to the second floor.

state.description: This is where you push food into your mouth, sometimes after cooking it. Stains and spills dot the floor, walls, and surfaces. In the center of the room is a counter where you usually prepare your food. On it rests a toaster, a blender, and a knife block. Standard kitchen appliances fill the room, like your refrigerator, sink, and a stovetop/oven. There is a door to the living room and a door leading to the back yard.
